paragraphs.content: Chapter 41
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 41

paragraphs.content: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?

paragraphs.content: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?

paragraphs.content: Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft words unto thee?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft words unto thee?

paragraphs.content: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?

paragraphs.content: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?

paragraphs.content: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?

paragraphs.content: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?

paragraphs.content: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.

paragraphs.content: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?

paragraphs.content: None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?
paragraphs.contentHtml: None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?

paragraphs.content: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.

paragraphs.content: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.

paragraphs.content: Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?

paragraphs.content: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.

paragraphs.content: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.

paragraphs.content: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

paragraphs.content: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.

paragraphs.content: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
paragraphs.contentHtml: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

paragraphs.content: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.

paragraphs.content: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.

paragraphs.content: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.

paragraphs.content: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.

paragraphs.content: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.

paragraphs.content: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.
paragraphs.contentHtml: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.

paragraphs.content: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.
paragraphs.contentHtml: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.

paragraphs.content: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.

paragraphs.content: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.

paragraphs.content: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.

paragraphs.content: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.

paragraphs.content: Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.

paragraphs.content: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.

paragraphs.content: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.

paragraphs.content: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.

paragraphs.content: He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.
